Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it.

1. INTERESTING HISTORY
   What year did you start housekeeping in Montana or Canada?

   How long had you been living there before that?
   For how many years did you prepare meals?
   How far was it to your nearest store?
   How often could a visit be made to the store?
   What provisions did you usually buy in those earlier years?

Massie, Mrs. Wm., Nokomis, 1926

1. WHERE DID YOU START HOUSEHOLDING IN EASTERN CANADA?

   What year did you start householding in Eastern Canada? 1906.

   Where had you been living before that? Red Deer.

   For how many years did you live there? 7.

   How far from there to your nearest store? 3 miles.

   How often could a visit be made to the store? 3 times a year.

   What provisions did you usually buy in those earliest years? Corned beef, oatmeal, sugar.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

   What brand of wheat flour did you use in the early years? Royal Homestead.

   In what quantities did you buy it? 100 lbs.

   What was the usual price per hundred pounds of wheat flour? $2.50.

   How much did you use rather than buy? 100 lbs.

   What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? 72¢.

   What other grain products did you use? Corn meal, flour.

   Other?

   Did you raise your own crops for personal use? Yes.

   Had you purchased it? Small amounts.
